article_title: Inflation’s Steady Tick Poses Headaches in Congress
article_text:
The U.S. government has an inflation challenge.

Many familiar programs, from Social Security to income-tax thresholds, are indexed to inflation and rise accordingly. Many dozens more aren’t, a simple fact now causing heartburn among policy makers and politicians in Washington.

twitter.description: The gas tax, minimum wage and overtime pay have been eroded over the years because they aren’t indexed to inflation, stirring fights over whether it is time for Congress to adjust them.
